I.name: Martial Poise
description:
{{sbc|Innate:}} Whenever '''Kalista''' inputs a movement command during her ''{{ai|Basic Attack|Kalista|basic attack}}'' windup or the cast time of ''{{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}'', she will {{tip|dash}} in the target direction.

'''''Kalista's''' dash from Martial Poise will be {{tip|knockdown|knocked down}} by any {{tip|immobilize|immobilizing}} or {{tip|polymorph|polymorphing}} crowd control, excluding {{tip|sleep}}{{bug}}.''

The range and speed of ''Martial Poise'' are modified by the tier of '''Kalista's''' [[Boots]]. The base range when dashing from a basic attack is {{pp|250;265;280|None;Basic;Finished|type=Boots Tier}} units. This base distance is reduced when dashing toward the direction of her attack, to a minimum of {{pp|150;165;180|None;Basic;Finished|type=Boots Tier}} units.

The base range when dashing from ''{{ai|Pierce|Kalista|Pierce's}}'' cast is increased{{ft|by 50 units.|to {{pp|300;315;330|None;Basic;Finished|type=Boots Tier}} units.}}If dashing ''away'' from the point of cast, the dash range is reduced, to a minimum of {{pp|165;180;195|None;Basic;Finished|type=Boots Tier}} units.
{{sbc|Innate - Oathsworn Bond:}} '''Kalista''' begins the game with an exclusive ''{{ii|Black Spear}}''.
I.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Whenever Kalista inputs a movement command during her Kalista's basic attack windup or the cast time of Kalista's Pierce, she will dash in the target direction.

Kalista's dash from Martial Poise will be knocked down by any immobilizing or polymorphing crowd control, excluding sleepUnknown value: bug.
The range and speed of Martial Poise are modified by the tier of Kalista's Boots. The base range when dashing from a basic attack is None;Basic;Finished ‒ undefined units. This base distance is reduced when dashing toward the direction of her attack, to a minimum of None;Basic;Finished ‒ undefined units.
The base range when dashing from Kalista's Pierce's cast is increasedIf dashing away from the point of cast, the dash range is reduced, to a minimum of None;Basic;Finished ‒ undefined units.
Innate - Oathsworn Bond: Kalista begins the game with an exclusive Black Spear.
I.notes:
* There is a very brief grace period in excess of the on-screen timers wherein '''Kalista''' can still trigger ''Martial Poise''.
* The dash speed depends on '''Kalista's''' {{as|'''bonus''' attack speed}} and {{ig|Boots}} Tier. Basic boots increase the dash speed by 75, and Finished boots increase it by 135.
* The dash speed is affected by {{as|{{stil|multiplicative movement speed modifiers}}}} such as {{tip|slow|slows}}.
** {{as|{{sti|movement speed|Additive movement speed modifiers}}|movement speed}} do not affect it.
* There are a total of 24 different dash ranges based on direction with {{ig|Boots}} and {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}} being cast.
* Dash distance decreases exponentially as the dash direction becomes closer to the minimum direction (forward for basic attacks, backward for {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}. <!-- Determine exact calculation. Seems to at least be a steady decrease until the difference in angle from target to dash position is less than 15 degrees, at which point the distance drops off significantly. -->
* '''Kalista''' will attempt to attack her target again at the end of the dash, allowing the player to kite with only movement commands as long as they remain in attack range.
* Attack move click checks for targets in brief intervals, but only while '''Kalista''' is not in a dash, resulting in lost DPS if it is used to automatically dash.
* '''Kalista's''' facing direction when dashing is considered to be in the direction of the dash, not her visual facing direction.

Q.name: Pierce
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' throws a spear in the target direction that deals {{as|physical damage}} to the first enemy hit.

If ''Pierce'' kills the target, the spear continues onward to transfer all of the target's ''{{ai|Rend|Kalista}}'' stacks to the next enemy it hits. This can repeat indefinitely until the spear reaches its maximum range.
Q.descriptionHtml:
Active: Kalista throws a spear in the target direction that deals physical damage to the first enemy hit.
If Pierce kills the target, the spear continues onward to transfer all of the target's Kalista's Rend stacks to the next enemy it hits. This can repeat indefinitely until the spear reaches its maximum range.

W.name: Sentinel
description: {{sbc|Passive - Soul-Marked:}} While '''Kalista''' and her ''{{ii|The Black Spear|Oathsworn}}'' are {{tip|tether|tethered}}, their basic attacks and ''{{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}'' apply a ''Soul-Mark'' to their targets.

If both ''Soul-Marks'' are applied to the same target within 4 seconds, they take {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}, capped against non-champions, and cannot be ''Soul-Marked'' again for a few seconds. ''Soul-Mark'' deals a minimum of 75 damage to {{tip|minions}} and executes them if they're below {{as|{{sti|health|125 health}}}}. '''Kalista''' applies the damage {{tip|on-attack}} while the ''Oathsworn'' does so {{tip|on-hit}}.
{{sbc|Passive:}} '''Kalista''' periodically [[stock]]s a ''Sentinel'' charge, up to a maximum of 2.
{{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' summons a ''Sentinel'' that patrols back and forth on a path to the target location, granting {{tip|sight}} along its trajectory as it travels.
W.descriptionHtml:
Passive - Soul-Marked: While Kalista and her The Black Spear are tethered, their basic attacks and Kalista's Pierce apply a Soul-Mark to their targets.
If both Soul-Marks are applied to the same target within 4 seconds, they take bonus magic damage, capped against non-champions, and cannot be Soul-Marked again for a few seconds. Soul-Mark deals a minimum of 75 damage to minions and executes them if they're below 125 health. Kalista applies the damage on-attack while the Oathsworn does so on-hit.
Passive: Kalista periodically stocks a Sentinel charge, up to a maximum of 2.
Active: Kalista summons a Sentinel that patrols back and forth on a path to the target location, granting sight along its trajectory as it travels.
See Kalista/LoL#Pets for more details about Sentinels.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Magic Damage|{{as|{{ap|14 to 18}}% of target's '''maximum''' health}}|Maximum Non-Champion Damage|{{ap|100 to 200}}}}
W.notes:
* ''Soul-Marked's'' bonus damage is credited to '''Kalista''' and will benefit from both her {{sti|magic penetration|{{as|magic penetration}}}} and [[spell effects]].
** If her {{ii|The Black Spear|Oathsworn}} ally scores a kill using ''Soul-Marked's'' bonus damage they will get a message stating 'Kill Secured' in place of the usual gold pop-up (the gold itself is credited to '''Kalista''').
* The ''Sentinel's'' {{tip|sight}} reveal on enemy {{tip|champion|champions}} is accredited for [[assist|assists]] and potentially [[kill|kills]] (if they die shortly after being spotted).
** It does not reveal {{tip|stealth|stealthed}} targets.
* ''Sentinel'' will cast from wherever '''Kalista''' is at the end of the cast time.
* {{Pending for test}}: ''Soul Mark's'' interaction with ''parrying'' effects ({{tip|dodge}}, {{tip|block}}, {{tip|blind}}).
* {{pending for test}} If ''Pierce'' kills the target by ''Soul-Mark's'' additional damage, it will/will not continue.

effects.str:
• Bonus Magic Damage: % of target's maximum health
  • Maximum Non-Champion Damage:

E.name: Rend
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Kalista's''' basic attacks {{tip|on-hit}} and ''{{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}'' apply a [[stack]] of ''Rend'' that last 4 seconds, which refreshes on subsequent hits and stacks up to 254 times.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' rips all lodged spears from valid nearby enemies, consuming all of their stacks to deal them {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|slow}} them for 2 seconds. Each additional spear on the target deals reduced damage. ''Rend'' deals 50% reduced damage against epic {{tip|monsters}}.
If ''Rend'' [[kill]]s at least one target, the cooldown is {{sti|cdr|reset}} and '''Kalista''' restores {{sti|{{as|mana}}}}.
''A nearby enemy with a Rend stack is required to cast this ability.''

''Rend'' can be used during the dash of ''{{ai|Martial Poise|Kalista}}'' and the cast time of ''{{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}''. In-flight spears and ''{{ai|Pierce|Kalista}}'' if in cast will be empowered to apply ''Rend's'' effects to their targets. These empowered spears can also trigger ''Rend's'' refund.
E.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Kalista's basic attacks on-hit and Kalista's Pierce apply a stack of Rend that last 4 seconds, which refreshes on subsequent hits and stacks up to 254 times.
Active: Kalista rips all lodged spears from valid nearby enemies, consuming all of their stacks to deal them physical damage and slow them for 2 seconds. Each additional spear on the target deals reduced damage. Rend deals 50% reduced damage against epic monsters.
If Rend kills at least one target, the cooldown is reset and Kalista restores mana.
A nearby enemy with a Rend stack is required to cast this ability.
Rend can be used during the dash of Kalista's Martial Poise and the cast time of Kalista's Pierce. In-flight spears and Kalista's Pierce if in cast will be empowered to apply Rend's effects to their targets. These empowered spears can also trigger Rend's refund.
leveling:
{{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|20 to 60}} {{as|(+ 70% AD)}}|Damage per Additional Spear|{{ap|10 to 34}} {{as|(+ {{ap|23.2 to 40.6}}% AD)}}}}
{{st|Slow|{{ap|10 to 42}}%}}
E.notes:
* ''Rend'' at maximum stacks will deal a total of {{as|{{ap|(20 to 60)+(10+3*(x-1)+x*(x-1)/2)*253}}|physical damage}} {{as|(+ {{ap|70*(1+0.33*253)|70*(1+0.3958*253) to 70*(1+0.5833*253) 4}}% AD)}} {{as|physical damage}}.
* ''Rend'' cannot activate on {{tip|untargetable}} enemies.
* ''Rend'' applies its effects instantly on cast.
* The cooldown will not reset if the target is protected by {{tip|resurrection}} effects.
* If ''Rend'' is used against {{ci|Sion}} under the effects of {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}}, the cooldown will reset even if it does not kill him.
* A stack is not applied if the attack is {{tip|dodge|dodged}}, {{tip|block|blocked}} or missed while '''Kalista''' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}. 
* {{Pending for test}}: {{ai|Pierce|Kalista}} does not apply a stack of ''Rend'' if blocked by {{tip|spell shield}}.

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 70% AD)
  • Damage per Additional Spear: (+ % AD)
  • Slow: %

R.name: Fate's Call
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Kalista''' invokes her {{ii|The Black Spear|tether}} to retrieve her ''Oathsworn'' and hold them for 4 seconds, {{tip|dash|pulling}} them to her over 1 second and {{tip|cleanse|cleansing}} them from all {{tip|crowd control}}, as well as rendering them {{tip|invulnerable}} and {{tip|untargetable}} for the duration.

While held, the ''Oathsworn'' is {{tip|vanish|vanished}} and may {{tip|dash}} with {{tip|displacement immunity}} to end ''Fate's Call's'' effects and reappear at the target location; after the duration, they will automatically do so at maximum range from '''Kalista's''' facing direction.
The ''Oathsworn'' stops upon colliding with an enemy {{tip|champion}}, {{tip|airborne|knocking}} up all nearby enemies for a duration, then landing to their {{sti|attack range|basic attack range}} from the target collided with.
''The Oathsworn must be nearby to cast this ability, and is also {{tip|silence|silenced}} and unable to perform movement or attack commands while Fate's Call is in effect.''
R.descriptionHtml:
Active: Kalista invokes her The Black Spear to retrieve her Oathsworn and hold them for 4 seconds, pulling them to her over 1 second and cleansing them from all crowd control, as well as rendering them invulnerable and untargetable for the duration.
While held, the Oathsworn is vanished and may dash with displacement immunity to end Fate's Call's effects and reappear at the target location; after the duration, they will automatically do so at maximum range from Kalista's facing direction.
The Oathsworn stops upon colliding with an enemy champion, knocking up all nearby enemies for a duration, then landing to their basic attack range from the target collided with.
The Oathsworn must be nearby to cast this ability, and is also silenced and unable to perform movement or attack commands while Fate's Call is in effect.
R.notes:
* The following will defer ''Fate's Call's'' effects at the time of cast to the end of their duration if the ''Oathsworn'' is:
** In a [[Channel#Casting Times|cast time]].
** {{tip|Channel|Channeling}}.
*** ''Fate's Call'' will not defer by the following channels: {{si|Recall}}, {{ai|Defiant Dance|Irelia}}, {{ai|Realm Warp|Ryze}}, and {{ai|The Culling|Lucian}}.
*** ''Fate's Call'' cannot be cast during the following channels: {{si|Teleport}}, {{ai|Gate|Twisted Fate}}, {{ai|Grand Starfall|Pantheon}}, {{ai|Hero's Entrance|Galio}} and {{ai|Stand United|Shen}}.
** Using an ability that preloads {{tip|unstoppableforcemarker|UnstoppableForceMarker}}.
*** If the ''Oathsworn'' is still occupied after 6 seconds of being deferred from this time, ''Fate's Call'' will cancel.
* ''Fate's Call'' will not pull the ''Oathsworn'' if they are {{tip|dash|dashing}} but they will be retrieved after 1 second regardless.
* ''Fate's Call'' can be cast even if the ''Oathsworn'' is {{tip|untargetable}}.
* ''Fate's Call'' is disabled if the ''Oathsworn'' is {{tip|resurrection|resurrecting}} or is being affected by another ''Fate's Call''.
* ''Fate's Call'' can be used even if the ''Oathsworn'' is in a {{tip|zombie state}}.
* ''Fate's Call'' does not render the target {{tip|vanish|vanished}} while being held if they are creating {{ais|E|Senna}} aura.
* The ''Oathsworn'' being held is represented by a light over '''Kalista's''' head.
* '''Kalista's''' [[death]] does not cancel ''Fate's Call''.
